chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Don W Schlote was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Don W Schlote was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $2,215.00. Balance to be paid from Prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS. PAID IN FULL.
Blood costs to be forwarded to the City of New Berlin Police.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns and liquor stores)

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Court costs and DNA to be paid from prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Juror's notes with Judge's response.
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire and Voir Dire List
Exhibits 1-4
Exhibit List and Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits filed.

Defendant Don W Schlote in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed to trial.  Parties have filed a stipulation regarding defendant's BAC level.  State moves Exhibit 4 into evidence, marked and received.  State moves Exhibit 1 into evidence, marked and received.  Parties stipulate to 6 prior convictions for the defendant.

Case called for 12-person jury trial.  Witnesses are excused from the courtroom.  Clerk swears in jurors.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire.  Defense conducts voir dire.  Parties conduct peremptory challenges.  Court instructs jurors.  Clerk announces 12 selected jurors.  Remaining jurors dismissed at 10:06.   Clerk swears in 12 selected jurors to try the issue.  Court takes a short recess at 10:05.

Court reconvenes at 10:18.  State makes opening statements.  Defense makes opening statement.  

Officer Joshua Ledzian of the New Berlin Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit #2, marked and received.  State presents Exhibit #3, marked and received.  Cross-examination by defense.  Redirect by State.  

Heather Boltz sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by defense.  

Officer Ryan Straus of the New Berlin Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by defense.  Redirect by State.  State rests.  

Court reads Stipulation regarding defendant's BAC level.  

Kathleen Schlote sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defense.  Cross-examination by State.  Court breaks for lunch at 11:54.  Jury ordered to return by 1:00.  

Court reconvenes at 1:07.  Court addresses jury instructions and jury verdict with parties.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding defendant's testimony.  Defendant will not testify.  

Jurors return to the courtroom at 1:25.  Christian Gentz sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defense.  Cross-examination by State.  Redirect by defense.  Defense rests.  Jurors are excused at 1:37.  

Court closes evidence.  No motions by either party.  Defense withdraws the banister motion previously filed in this matter.  Court would have found sufficient evidence to deny the banister motion.  

Jury recalled at 1:51.  Court gives jury instructions to jurors.  State presents closing arguments.  Defense presents closing arguments.  State presents final arguments.  Court gives final instructions to the jurors.  Clerk swears in bailiff.  Jurors leave courtroom for deliberations at 2:27.  

Jurors have questions.  Court has counsel return and recalls case.  Court responds back to jurors' note.

Jurors have questions.  Court has counsel return and recalls case.  Court responds back to jurors' note.  

Jurors have question.  Court has counsel return and recalls case.  Court responds back to jurors' note and provides jurors with Exhibits 2-4.

Jurors have questions.  Court has counsel return and recalls case.  Court responds back to jurors' note.  

Jurors have reached a verdict at 5:02.  Jurors enters the courtroom at 5:07.  Court reads the verdict.  Jurors find the defendant guilty on all charges.  Court polls jurors.  Jurors are excused.

State moves for judgment on Counts 1 and 2 and moves to dismiss Count 3 by operation of law.  Court enters judgment of conviction on Counts 1 and 2 and dismisses Count 3 by operation of law.  

State makes sentencing arguments.  Defense makes sentencing arguments.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

COUNT 1:

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 348 days).  Defendant is remanded to custody forthwith. 
  - 2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores);

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to New Berlin Police Department);

FINE:  $3,343.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



COUNT 2:

6 MONTHS JAIL, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.



State has 7 days to file letter with the Court if they object to 348 days of credit.
Filed by Defense
